intro: Calyptranthes peduncularis, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, yellow, and orange. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal and lowland areas of Hawaii. Calyptranthes peduncularis plays an important role in the local ecosystem and is considered a symbol of Hawaiian culture.
